title: Aluminum - Price - Chart - Historical Data - News
summary: Aluminum prices rose to 3,132.60 USD/T on February 9, 2026, up 0.67% from the previous day. Over the past month, prices have fallen 1.79%, but remain 17.48% higher than a year ago. The data was last updated on February 10, 2026.

title: Aluminium price rallies sharply as LME cash offer spikes to 3,083.5 per tonne
summary: On February 9, 2026, LME aluminium prices surged with the cash bid and offer rising by USD 38.5 per tonne or 1.3%, reaching USD 3,083 to 3,083.5 per tonne. Three-month forward contracts also increased by USD 44.5 per tonne or 1.5%. This reflects declining inventory amid market rally.

title: Seasonal weakness pressure dominates aluminium prices in the doldrums
summary: SHFE aluminium closed at RMB 23,525 per tonne, down 0.06%, while LME aluminium settled at USD 3,109 per tonne, down 0.67%. Spot A00 aluminium rose to RMB 23,400 per tonne amid slowing transactions before Chinese New Year. Secondary aluminium enterprises are suspending operations, leading to weaker demand and fluctuating prices.

title: LME Aluminium Prices February 2026: Market Forces and Volatility
summary: LME aluminium prices in February 2026 show volatility driven by economic forces, with cancelled warrants dropping 3.82%. The article explores key market dynamics affecting price fluctuations.

title: Bechtel to lead preparatory engineering work on Oklahoma aluminum project
summary: Emirates Global Aluminium (EGA) and Century Aluminum have selected Bechtel to conduct preparatory engineering for a new primary aluminum smelter in Inola, Oklahoma, the first in the US since 1980. The project aims to double US primary aluminum production using EGA's advanced EX technology, creating 1,000 permanent jobs and 4,000 construction jobs. Bechtel's work focuses on value improvement, modularization, and preparing for a final investment decision and construction start by end-2026.

title: Bechtel to lead preparatory engineering work on Oklahoma aluminum project
summary: EGA and Century Aluminum announced Bechtel will handle preparatory engineering for their planned aluminum smelter in Inola, Oklahoma, targeting doubled US primary production. The facility will employ EGA's efficient EX reduction technology and generate significant jobs during construction and operation. Bechtel is also addressing infrastructure, logistics, and modular construction to support local growth.

title: Century Aluminum taps Bechtel for Oklahoma smelter plan
summary: Century Aluminum and EGA (60%/40% ownership) have engaged Bechtel for engineering on a new Oklahoma smelter using EX technology, set to double US primary aluminum output. The project includes 1,000 permanent and 4,000 construction jobs, with preparatory work targeting construction by end-2026. It builds on prior announcements for a 750,000-tonne-per-year facility.

title: Bechtel to Lead Engineering for New US Primary Aluminum Smelter in Oklahoma
summary: Bechtel has been selected to lead engineering for a new primary aluminum smelter in Oklahoma by EGA and Century Aluminum, potentially doubling US production capacity. The project incorporates advanced technology and sustainability efforts. It marks a significant expansion in American aluminum manufacturing.

title: Next-Generation Smelting Technology for Sustainable Production
summary: Century Aluminum Company is backing a new U.S. primary aluminum smelter in Inola, Oklahoma, using Emirates Global Aluminum's (EGA) proprietary EX smelting technology. This advanced platform aims to improve productivity, reduce energy consumption per ton, and lower emissions, with the facility expected to produce up to 750,000 metric tons annually. The project strengthens domestic supply chains for automotive, aerospace, and defense sectors while creating jobs and reducing import reliance.

title: Uzbekistan Launches Its First Aluminum Can Plant with IFC Support to Drive Sustainable Production
summary: Uzbekistan has launched its first greenfield aluminum can production plant in Tashkent with IFC investment, supplying recyclable metal packaging to beverage producers and reducing import reliance. The facility will produce up to 1.1 billion cans annually using energy-efficient equipment to cut emissions and support climate goals. It is expected to create over 200 jobs and align with international sustainability standards.

title: Material Selection for Supply Chain Decarbonization
summary: Trane Technologies is advancing sustainability by developing recycled aluminum alloys with up to 80-84% recycled content for HVAC heat exchanger components, significantly reducing carbon emissions from virgin aluminum production. This multi-year R&D effort maintains performance standards while saving energy equivalent to powering 13,500 homes annually. The initiative supports broader goals of supply chain decarbonization and circularity.

title: HRC Steel - Price - Chart - Historical Data - News
summary: HRC Steel fell to 973.08 USD/T on February 9, 2026, down 0.40% from the previous day, though it has risen 3.19% over the past month and 28.21% year-over-year. It is expected to trade at 990.10 USD/T by quarter-end and 1070.89 USD/T in 12 months. Historical high was 1945 USD/T in September 2021.

title: NMDC Price Hike Amidst Soaring Costs Sparks Investor Scrutiny
summary: NMDC raised iron ore prices by ₹100 per tonne for lumps and fines effective February 10, 2026, to ₹4,700 and ₹4,000 per tonne respectively, responding to higher steel prices and rupee depreciation. EBITDA margins contracted from 36.1% to 28.2%, amid India's steel demand growth projection of 8% in FY2025/2026. Analyst views are mixed, with upgrades to 'Strong Buy' alongside 'Sell' ratings.

title: Tata Steel Ltd Hits Intraday High with 3.56% Surge on 10 Feb 2026
summary: Tata Steel's share price hit a 52-week high of Rs 208.15, up 3.56% intraday and 2.99% from previous close, outperforming the Ferrous Metals sector. The stock stayed above key moving averages, showing bullish momentum amid a positive market with Sensex up 0.3%. This follows two days of gains totaling 5.56%.

title: Steel Prices Rising Again? February 2026 Metal Roofing Market Update
summary: Steel mill prices are rising with extended lead times, domestic production up slightly to multi-month highs, and lean inventory levels. Energy costs and winter weather impact production, while interest rate relief signals potential demand increase. Contractors are advised to monitor for Q1/Q2 volatility.

title: AISI: Raw steel production increases to 5-month high
summary: US mills produced an estimated 1,783,000 short tons of raw steel in the week ending Feb. 7, up 1.4% from the previous week and marking a five-month high. Year-to-date production totals 9,557,000 short tons, up 3.7% from last year, with mill capability utilization at 77.1%. Production increased in four of five AISI regions.

title: JSW Steel consolidated steel production declines 2% to 24.75 lakh tonne in January
summary: JSW Steel's consolidated crude steel production for January 2026 fell 2% to 24.75 lakh tonnes year-over-year. US Ohio operations saw a 74% decline to 0.17 lakh tonnes due to a scheduled outage for caster upgrades from December 15, 2025, to January 11, 2026. Capacity utilization for Indian operations was 85%.

title: ArcelorMittal sees 2% rise in steel sales
summary: ArcelorMittal forecasts a 2% increase in global steel demand ex-China for 2026, with production and shipments expected to rise across all regions. European mills will benefit from trade measures like CBAM and new TRQ mechanisms. In 2025, sales fell to $61.35 billion but net income rose to $3.15 billion.

title: Vietnam's 2025 crude steel output hits 5-year high
summary: Vietnam’s crude steel output in 2025 reached 24.7 million tons, a 12% year-on-year increase and a five-year high. The Vietnam Steel Association forecasts 8-10% growth in 2026, with finished steel output at 33-34.5 million tons and domestic consumption at 26 million tons. Challenges include green standards and anti-dumping cases.

title: Steel Ministry signs MOUs for 85 projects under PLI
summary: The Union Ministry of Steel signed Memorandums of Understanding for 85 projects under the Production Linked Incentive scheme. These initiatives aim to boost steel production capacity in India.

title: Fujitsu launches demonstration experiment into green steel value flow utilizing blockchain technology to accelerate decarbonization in the steel industry
summary: Fujitsu has commenced a demonstration experiment on green steel value flow in the steel industry, selected by Japan's METI as part of its FY2025 Industrial Research Project. The project, running from December 2025 to February 2026, uses blockchain and data platforms to securely distribute environmental value data and ensure transaction confidentiality. It aims to accelerate decarbonization, promote DX in steel, and establish sustainable supply chains.

title: Signs Point to a Bright Future for U.S. Green Steel in 2026
summary: U.S. steel manufacturing is reviving with investor-backed green steel innovations offsetting potential emission rises amid weakening regulations. Key advancements include electric arc mini-mills using recycled scrap and low-carbon processes from startups like Hertha Metals and Electra, which are more energy-efficient and cost-competitive. These technologies have already cut U.S. steel emissions by 37% per ton since 1990.

title: Why 2026 could see momentum return to the steel technology transition
summary: After slower progress, the steel industry's shift from fossil fuels is expected to gain momentum in 2026 through renewed technology advancements. The article highlights potential accelerations in sustainable steel production methods.

title: Future of Steel: Trends, Technology & Sustainability 2026
summary: The article explores upcoming trends in steel for 2026, focusing on sustainability, scrap recycling, and emerging low-carbon technologies. It discusses how these innovations are reshaping steel production to meet environmental goals.

title: Thyssenkrupp Ag News: Driving Innovation in Steelmaking Tech
summary: Thyssenkrupp is advancing innovation, digitalization, and green technologies in steelmaking to meet global demand for sustainable manufacturing. The company is focusing on low-carbon solutions amid shifting industry needs.

title: Comex Copper Settles 1.39% Higher at $5.9450 — Data Talk
summary: Front Month Comex Copper for February delivery rose 8.15 cents per pound, or 1.39%, to settle at $5.9450, marking the largest one-day gain since February 3, 2026. The price has increased over two consecutive sessions and 2.52% in the last two sessions. Year-to-date, it is up 5.60%, though off 3.73% from its 52-week high.

title: Copper price forecast for 2026: Goldman Sachs
summary: Goldman Sachs forecasts copper prices to stay around $13,000 per tonne in the first half of 2026 before declining to $11,200 by year-end, assuming a US 15% tariff on refined copper by mid-2026. The price recently rebounded to $13,117 per tonne after a sell-off triggered by US dollar strength. ASX copper shares and ETFs rose today amid ongoing recovery and uncertainty supporting current levels.

title: Copper price forecast for 2026: Goldman Sachs
summary: Goldman Sachs forecasts copper prices to remain around $13,000 per tonne in early 2026 before declining to $11,200 by year-end, citing a short-term 600 kilotonne surplus in 2025 but long-term supply constraints due to lengthy mine development times and declining ore grades in Chile. Demand is driven by grid infrastructure, EVs, renewables, China's building sector, and data centers. The article notes restricted supply amid rising demand from energy transition.

title: Copper - Price - Chart - Historical Data - News
summary: Copper prices fell to 5.91 USD/Lbs on February 10, 2026, amid supply challenges from power outages at major mines and conservative production guidance. The China Nonferrous Metals Industry Association projects refined copper output to rise about 5% in 2026, half the 2025 growth rate. Global demand remains robust from energy transition and data-center expansion despite short-term pressures.

title: AWS to Source Low Carbon Nuton Copper from Rio Tinto for U.S. Data Center Infrastructure
summary: AWS and Rio Tinto have partnered to source low-carbon copper produced through Nuton's innovative technology, which uses naturally occurring microorganisms to extract copper from primary sulphide ores. The process eliminates traditional concentrators and smelters, reducing water use and emissions while producing 99.99% pure copper cathode at the mine gate. AWS's cloud analytics expertise will help optimize and verify the technology's performance across operations.

title: Positive environmental stories from February 2026
summary: This article covers multiple environmental innovations from February 2026, including Finland's use of sand for industrial heat decarbonization, a sustainable fungicide alternative to copper-pesticides for French vineyards, and wind and solar overtaking fossil fuels in EU electricity generation for the first time in 2025.

title: SMM Nickel Midday Review: Nickel prices edged lower on February 10 with market trading turning sluggish
summary: On February 10, SMM #1 refined nickel prices ranged from 133,400-144,500 yuan/mt, averaging 138,950 yuan/mt, down 500 yuan/mt from the previous day. Market trading turned sluggish ahead of the Chinese New Year holiday, with futures prices fluctuating lower and spot prices weakening due to stagnant demand. Post-holiday focus will be on Indonesia's nickel ore quota policy implementation.

title: SMM Nickel News
summary: SMM reports #1 refined nickel prices on February 10 at 133,400–144,500 yuan/mt, averaging 138,950 yuan/mt, a decline of 500 yuan/mt from the prior session. The update highlights ongoing spot market assessments amid broader nickel market dynamics.

title: Nickel price spikes more than 10% as Chinese buying fuels metals surge
summary: Nickel prices spiked over 10% in London, reaching $18,785/ton on the LME, driven by Chinese investor buying and production risks in Indonesia despite oversupply. This marks a reversal from prior weakness in EV battery usage, with LME nickel closing up 9% at $18,524/ton. Trading volumes surged during Asian hours, signaling strong Chinese influence on metals like nickel, copper, and tin.

title: Nickel Headed to $20,000 as Indonesia Limits Production, EV Demand Surges
summary: Nickel prices traded between $16,500-$18,500/ton in January, supported by Indonesia's 2026 ore production target of 250-260 million tons, flat-to-down from 2025. EV demand grows at 20% annually, with expectations for prices to reach $20,000/ton soon as supply discipline is confirmed. Stainless steel demand provides baseline support amid tightening fundamentals.

title: Nickel Market Eyes $20,000 as Supply Discipline Meets Surging Demand
summary: The nickel market shows a constructive 2026 outlook with prices in $16,500-$18,500/ton range after hitting $19,000, backed by Indonesia's flat 2026 ore targets of 250-260 million tons. Canada Nickel CEO Mark Selby predicts a move to $20,000/ton within a month upon production data confirmation, driven by EV growth and supply chain tightening. Ore, nickel pig iron, and stainless steel prices at three-year highs indicate real market tightening.

title: Nickel Headed to $20,000 as Indonesia Limits Production, EV Demand Surges
summary: Nickel prices are strengthening due to Indonesia's commitment to flat 2026 ore production targets of 250-260 million tons, amid robust EV demand growth of 20% annually. This supply discipline is expected to drive prices toward $20,000 per ton within the next month. Canada Nickel's Crawford project advances toward year-end 2026 construction start.

title: Nickel - Price - Chart - Historical Data - News
summary: Nickel futures rose to around $17,200-$17,400 per tonne, supported by concerns over Indonesian supply constraints as smelters fail to submit reports, potentially disrupting exports. Indonesia confirmed cutting mining permits to 260 million wet tons in 2026 from 379 million last year. Philippine DMCI Mining targets 3 million WMT output in 2026 after record 2025 production.

title: [SMM Analysis] Nickel Market Trend Analysis from February 10 to ...
summary: China's refined nickel production in February 2026 is expected to reach 35,000 mt, up 4.1% month-on-month and 43.1% year-on-year. This growth is driven by new projects gradually coming online. The analysis covers recent market trends amid global supply dynamics.

title: DMCI Mining hits record nickel output as Zambales, Long Point ramp-up
summary: DMCI Mining achieved record 2 million wet metric tons of nickel ore production in 2025, up 33% from 2024, with shipments at 1.9 million WMT. Growth came from higher Zambales output and initial Long Point operations. The company targets 3 million WMT in 2026 amid improving nickel market fundamentals.

title: Nickel Market Eyes $20,000 as Supply Discipline Meets Surging ...
summary: The nickel market shows a constructive outlook in early 2026, backed by Indonesia's 250-260 million ton ore production targets and strong demand. Prices trade in $16,500-$18,500 range after hitting $19,000. Canada Nickel advances Crawford project with engineering and financing milestones for 2026 construction.

title: Nickel Industries showcases sustainability in quarterly update
summary: Nickel Industries Limited reported stable operations and a perfect safety record with zero lost-time injuries and 17.7 million safe man-hours in its Quarterly Activities Report ending December 2025. The company advanced sustainability through a strategic acquisition of a 10% stake in Excelsior Nickel Cobalt and received awards for ESG leadership. This highlights their focus on workforce safety, governance, and integration into high-standard global supply chains.

title: Sustainable batteries: Materials, technologies and the road ahead
summary: Nickel is increasingly replacing cobalt in battery cathodes due to cobalt mining issues, enhancing sustainability. Innovations include silicon anodes from companies like Sila and Amprius, offering higher energy capacity as graphite alternatives. The article stresses the need for recyclable battery designs amid looming shortages of cobalt, nickel, and lithium.

title: Follow the Money: The U.S. Government Funding Hit List for Critical Minerals Companies 2023-2026
summary: 6K Inc. receives US$23.4M DoD funding for UniMelt® technology to produce nickel superalloys and other metals from sustainable scrap sources for defense applications. This supports domestic closed-loop production of critical minerals like nickel, reducing reliance on fragile supply chains. The focus is on upcycling end-of-life components into high-grade powders.

title: PH moves to diversify markets, expand critical minerals processing
summary: The Philippines aims to shift from exporting raw nickel ores to value-added processing, emphasizing environmental sustainability and responsible mining. Initiatives include technology transfer, advanced research, and integration of recycling technologies to attract investments. This positions the country as a trusted green supplier of critical minerals.

title: Hydrogen to decarbonize steel: first trial launched in Italy
summary: Tenaris, in collaboration with Snam and Tenova, launched the first trial in Italy using hydrogen at a steel plant to process steel products at its Dalmine mill in Bergamo. The six-month trial aims to evaluate the performance and reliability of hydrogen as a fuel in the steel industry and develop safety guidelines for hard-to-abate sectors.

title: Advancing power generation: Tenaris in dialogue with Macchi at Hydrogen Expo 2025
summary: Tenaris participated in the Hydrogen Expo 2025 in Piacenza, Italy, showcasing its steel solutions for power generation applications. The company highlighted its 25+ year partnership with Sofinter Group and its investments in high-performance tubular solutions engineered for extreme temperatures and sustainability.

title: Tenaris supports HRSG projects worldwide to meet rising electricity demand
summary: Tenaris secured agreements for 15 HRSG (heat recovery steam generator) projects in 2025, totaling over 17,000 tons of pipes produced at its Silcotub mill in Romania. The projects support combined-cycle power plants responding to increased electricity demand driven by data centers and artificial intelligence expansion.
